    Example of regstudies workflow

    example.Rmd

    Install and load necessary libraries for this example

    library(regstudies)
library(tidyverse)
library(vroom)
library(lubridate)

    Data preparation

    For demonstration purpose we are going to create random cohort and registry datasets

    ## Generate random cohort id data
cohort_data <- tibble::tibble(
  personid = seq(1201, 1500),
  gender = sample(c(1,2), 300, replace = T),
  postingdate = rep(as.Date("2000-01-01"), 300)
)

## Generate random icd data
random_icd_codes <- c(
  paste0("F0", seq(1,9)),
  paste0("F", seq(10,48)),
  paste0("F", seq(50,98)),
  paste0("I0", seq(0,2)),
  paste0("I0", seq(05,09)),
  paste0("I", seq(10,16)),
  paste0("I", seq(20,25)),
  paste0("I", seq(30,52)),
  paste0("I", seq(60,99)),
  paste0("E0", seq(0,7)),
  paste0("E0", seq(08,13)),
  paste0("E", seq(15,16)),
  paste0("E", seq(20,35)),
  paste0("E", seq(40,46)),
  paste0("E", seq(70,89))
)
reg_data <- tibble::tibble(
  personid = sample(cohort_data$personid, 10000, replace = TRUE),
  CODE1 = sample(random_icd_codes, 10000, replace = TRUE),
  adm_date = sample(seq(as.Date("1990-01-01"), as.Date("2005-12-31"), by = 1), 10000, replace = T)
  # disc_date = ,
)
reg_data$disc_date <- (reg_data$adm_date + sample(seq(0,180), 10000, replace = T))

    Sample dataset

    Dataset cohort_data is base dataset including basic descriptive variables of the population (in this case only gener) and variable posting_date which is a survey letter posting date:

    summary(cohort_data)
    ##     personid        gender      postingdate        
##  Min.   :1201   Min.   :1.00   Min.   :2000-01-01  
##  1st Qu.:1276   1st Qu.:1.00   1st Qu.:2000-01-01  
##  Median :1350   Median :2.00   Median :2000-01-01  
##  Mean   :1350   Mean   :1.53   Mean   :2000-01-01  
##  3rd Qu.:1425   3rd Qu.:2.00   3rd Qu.:2000-01-01  
##  Max.   :1500   Max.   :2.00   Max.   :2000-01-01

    Dataset reg_data is a dataset which has events for the selected population with ICD codes and date-variables:

    summary(reg_data)
    ##     personid       CODE1              adm_date            disc_date         
##  Min.   :1201   Length:10000       Min.   :1990-01-02   Min.   :1990-01-22  
##  1st Qu.:1277   Class :character   1st Qu.:1993-12-06   1st Qu.:1994-03-05  
##  Median :1351   Mode  :character   Median :1997-11-29   Median :1998-02-24  
##  Mean   :1351                      Mean   :1997-12-08   Mean   :1998-03-08  
##  3rd Qu.:1426                      3rd Qu.:2001-12-16   3rd Qu.:2002-03-14  
##  Max.   :1500                      Max.   :2005-12-31   Max.   :2006-06-22

    Joining these two datasets we got dataset ready for analyzes:

    # Join register data with population cohort data
d <- reg_data %>%
  left_join(cohort_data)
    ## Joining, by = "personid"
    head(d)
    ## # A tibble: 6 x 6
##   personid CODE1 adm_date   disc_date  gender postingdate
##      <int> <chr> <date>     <date>      <dbl> <date>     
## 1     1387 E013  2004-06-09 2004-11-21      1 2000-01-01 
## 2     1245 F03   2005-12-02 2006-03-25      1 2000-01-01 
## 3     1368 E89   1998-10-24 1999-03-03      2 2000-01-01 
## 4     1356 F18   2005-12-29 2006-03-24      1 2000-01-01 
## 5     1256 E45   1993-10-02 1993-11-03      1 2000-01-01 
## 6     1207 E75   1999-01-25 1999-02-20      2 2000-01-01

    We can also create a new help variable icd which determines if code is ICD-8, ICD-9 or ICD-10 by year:

    # Determine if codes are ICD-8, ICD-9 or ICD-10
d <- d %>%
  mutate(icd = case_when(
    year(disc_date) < 1987 ~ "icd8",
    year(disc_date) < 1996 & year(disc_date)>=1987 ~ "icd9",
    year(disc_date) >= 1996 ~ "icd10"
    ))

    Get first event per id

    With tidyverse verbs you can slice first occurence by

    d %>%
  group_by(personid) %>%
  arrange(adm_date) %>%
  dplyr::slice(1)
    ## # A tibble: 300 x 7
## # Groups:   personid [300]
##    personid CODE1 adm_date   disc_date  gender postingdate icd  
##       <int> <chr> <date>     <date>      <dbl> <date>      <chr>
##  1     1201 I43   1990-01-22 1990-03-06      2 2000-01-01  icd9 
##  2     1202 I06   1990-04-08 1990-09-23      1 2000-01-01  icd9 
##  3     1203 I61   1990-09-15 1990-10-13      2 2000-01-01  icd9 
##  4     1204 I92   1990-04-29 1990-06-27      2 2000-01-01  icd9 
##  5     1205 E31   1990-01-04 1990-01-24      1 2000-01-01  icd9 
##  6     1206 E06   1990-01-18 1990-04-25      1 2000-01-01  icd9 
##  7     1207 F58   1990-02-19 1990-07-17      2 2000-01-01  icd9 
##  8     1208 E28   1990-01-23 1990-02-19      1 2000-01-01  icd9 
##  9     1209 I93   1990-06-22 1990-07-19      1 2000-01-01  icd9 
## 10     1210 E40   1990-03-05 1990-04-25      1 2000-01-01  icd9 
## # ... with 290 more rows

    and with regstudies verbs you can do the same with

    d %>%
  group_by(personid) %>%
  regstudies::get_first(var = adm_date)
    ## # A tibble: 300 x 7
## # Groups:   personid [300]
##    personid CODE1 adm_date   disc_date  gender postingdate icd  
##       <int> <chr> <date>     <date>      <dbl> <date>      <chr>
##  1     1201 I43   1990-01-22 1990-03-06      2 2000-01-01  icd9 
##  2     1202 I06   1990-04-08 1990-09-23      1 2000-01-01  icd9 
##  3     1203 I61   1990-09-15 1990-10-13      2 2000-01-01  icd9 
##  4     1204 I92   1990-04-29 1990-06-27      2 2000-01-01  icd9 
##  5     1205 E31   1990-01-04 1990-01-24      1 2000-01-01  icd9 
##  6     1206 E06   1990-01-18 1990-04-25      1 2000-01-01  icd9 
##  7     1207 F58   1990-02-19 1990-07-17      2 2000-01-01  icd9 
##  8     1208 E28   1990-01-23 1990-02-19      1 2000-01-01  icd9 
##  9     1209 I93   1990-06-22 1990-07-19      1 2000-01-01  icd9 
## 10     1210 E40   1990-03-05 1990-04-25      1 2000-01-01  icd9 
## # ... with 290 more rows

    Filtering by date periods

    Filter dataset with occurences of hospital visits. If person has been in hospital during the time period two years prior postingdate then those events are included.

    filtered_d <- d %>%
  filter_date_interval(indexdate = postingdate,
                       time_before=years(2),
                       admission_date=adm_date,
                       discharge_date=disc_date)
head(filtered_d)
    ## # A tibble: 6 x 7
##   personid CODE1 adm_date   disc_date  gender postingdate icd  
##      <int> <chr> <date>     <date>      <dbl> <date>      <chr>
## 1     1368 E89   1998-10-24 1999-03-03      2 2000-01-01  icd10
## 2     1207 E75   1999-01-25 1999-02-20      2 2000-01-01  icd10
## 3     1414 I90   1999-10-25 2000-04-09      1 2000-01-01  icd10
## 4     1423 I82   1999-06-09 1999-07-28      1 2000-01-01  icd10
## 5     1364 I81   1999-07-21 1999-11-25      1 2000-01-01  icd10
## 6     1470 I71   1999-01-17 1999-07-04      1 2000-01-01  icd10

    Filter dataset with either adm_date or disc_date within two years around postingdate

    filtered_d <- d %>%
  regstudies::filter_date(indexdate=postingdate,
                          range=years(2),
                          adm_date,
                          disc_date)
head(filtered_d)
    ## # A tibble: 6 x 7
##   personid CODE1 adm_date   disc_date  gender postingdate icd  
##      <int> <chr> <date>     <date>      <dbl> <date>      <chr>
## 1     1368 E89   1998-10-24 1999-03-03      2 2000-01-01  icd10
## 2     1207 E75   1999-01-25 1999-02-20      2 2000-01-01  icd10
## 3     1414 I90   1999-10-25 2000-04-09      1 2000-01-01  icd10
## 4     1423 I82   1999-06-09 1999-07-28      1 2000-01-01  icd10
## 5     1333 I79   2001-04-22 2001-07-21      1 2000-01-01  icd10
## 6     1364 I81   1999-07-21 1999-11-25      1 2000-01-01  icd10

    Classifications

    Code classification by own csv table

    # Classify by Elixhauser:
my_classes <- read_classes_csv(file = "../data/elixhauser_classes.csv")
    ## Rows: 31
## Columns: 6
## Delimiter: ";"
## chr [4]: class_elixhauser, label_elixhauser, icd9, icd10
## dbl [2]: score_AHRQ, score_van_Walraven
## 
## Use `spec()` to retrieve the guessed column specification
## Pass a specification to the `col_types` argument to quiet this message
    ## Joining, by = "label_elixhauser"
    View(my_classes)
View(filtered_d)
#filtered_d %>%
#  make_classify_table(icdcodes = CODE1,my_classes)
classified_d <- filtered_d %>%
  classify_codes(codes = CODE1,
                 diag_tbl = my_classes)
    ## [1] "Element 'regex.rm' NOT in use. Exceptions omitted."
    head(classified_d)
    ## # A tibble: 6 x 11
##   personid CODE1 adm_date   disc_date  gender postingdate icd   class_elixhauser

## 2     1207 E75   1999-01-25 1999-02-20      2 2000-01-01  icd10 <NA>

## #   score_van_Walraven <dbl>

    Elixhauser classification and scores

    This calculates per row elixhauser classification. Check more info of classification from classification tables-section.

    elixscore <- filtered_d %>%
  classify_elixhauser(icd_codes = CODE1)
    ## Joining, by = "label"
    ## [1] "Element 'regex.rm' NOT in use. Exceptions omitted."
    head(elixscore)
    ## # A tibble: 6 x 12
##   personid CODE1 adm_date   disc_date  gender postingdate icd   classification
##      <int> <chr> <date>     <date>      <dbl> <date>      <chr> <chr>         
## 1     1368 E89   1998-10-24 1999-03-03      2 2000-01-01  icd10 <NA>          
## 2     1207 E75   1999-01-25 1999-02-20      2 2000-01-01  icd10 <NA>          
## 3     1414 I90   1999-10-25 2000-04-09      1 2000-01-01  icd10 <NA>          
## 4     1423 I82   1999-06-09 1999-07-28      1 2000-01-01  icd10 <NA>          
## 5     1333 I79   2001-04-22 2001-07-21      1 2000-01-01  icd10 <NA>          
## 6     1364 I81   1999-07-21 1999-11-25      1 2000-01-01  icd10 <NA>          
## # ... with 4 more variables: class_ <chr>, label_ <chr>, score_AHRQ <int>,
## #   score_van_Walraven <int>
    ### TODO KIRJOITA AUKI
charlson <- filtered_d %>%
  classify_charlson(icd_codes = CODE1)

## Funktio oletuksena
d %>%
  classify_codes() -> long # ns. tidy standardi

## ok, kaytaja haluaa leveassa muodossa
## esimerkkiin
d %>%
  classify_codes() %>%
  dplyr:: pivot_longer() -> wide

    Calculate Elixhauser scores by id's

    # Calculate scores
filtered_d %>%
  classify_elixhauser(icd_codes = CODE1) %>%
  sum_score(score_AHRQ, score_van_Walraven)
    ## Joining, by = "label"
    ## [1] "Element 'regex.rm' NOT in use. Exceptions omitted."
    ## # A tibble: 300 x 3
##    personid `sum(score_AHRQ)` `sum(score_van_Walraven)`
##       <int>             <int>                     <int>
##  1     1201                -1                         0
##  2     1202                10                         5
##  3     1203                 0                         0
##  4     1204                -5                         0
##  5     1205                 9                         6
##  6     1206                 0                         0
##  7     1207                -2                         6
##  8     1208                 0                        -1
##  9     1209                -6                        -1
## 10     1210                 0                         0
## # ... with 290 more rows

elixscore
elixscore <- left_join_replace_na(cohort %>% select(personid), elixscore)
#View(elixscore)

# [X] demoa Hospital Frailty Risk Score -indeksiä!

# - korjaa classify_data_long -funktio sellaiseksi että se palauttaa koko datan!

    Charlson classification

    # Charlson score:
#charlson_classes <- classes_to_wide(vroom(file = "data/classification_codes/charlson_classes_wide.csv"))
charlson_classes <- read_classes_csv(file = "data/classification_codes/charlson_classes_wide.csv")
#View(charlson_classes)

# dev:
dev1<-filtereddata %>%
  classify_data_long(icdcodes=CODE1,diag_tbl=charlson_classes)
dev2<-filtereddata %>%
  classify_long(icdcodes=CODE1,diag_tbl=charlson_classes)
dim(filtereddata)
dim(dev1)
dim(dev2)
# TODO: Jotain kummaa tässä on!

charlsonscore <- filtereddata %>%
  classify_data_long(icdcodes=CODE1,diag_tbl=charlson_classes) %>%
  rename(score_charlson=score) %>%
  sum_score(score_charlson)
charlsonscore <- left_join(cohort %>% select(personid), charlsonscore)
#View(charlsonscore)

# Hospital Frailty Risk Score:
hfrs_dat<-vroom(file = "data/classification_codes/hospital_frailty_risk_score_wide.csv")
hfrs_dat<-hfrs_dat %>%
  mutate(label="Frail group") %>%
  select(classification,class,label,score,icd10)
names(hfrs_dat)
write.table(hfrs_dat,file="data/classification_codes/hospital_frailty_risk_score_wide_v2.csv",sep=";",dec=".",row.names = FALSE)
View(hfrs_dat)
hfrs_classes <- read_classes_csv(file = "data/classification_codes/hospital_frailty_risk_score_wide_v2.csv")
#View(charlson_classes)
hfrsscore <- filtereddata %>%
  classify_data_long(icdcodes=CODE1,diag_tbl=hfrs_classes) %>%
  rename(score_charlson=score) %>%
  sum_score(score_charlson)

mode <- function(x) { # by Ken Williams at stackoverflow
  ux <- unique(x)
  ux <- ux[!is.na(ux)]
  ux[which.max(tabulate(match(x, ux)))]
}
mode(hfrsscore$classification)


hfrsscore <- left_join(cohort %>% select(personid), hfrsscore) %>%
  mutate(classification=mode(classification))
#  mutate(classification=ifelse(is.na(classification),mode(classification),classification))
View(hfrsscore)

dim(filtereddata %>% select(personid) %>% distinct())
dim(cohort)
dim(elixscore)
dim(charlsonscore)

bothscores<-left_join(elixscore %>% select(-classification),
                      charlsonscore %>% select(-classification),by="personid")
fill_na<-function(x,fill=0) ifelse(is.na(x),fill,x)
cohortscores<-left_join(cohort %>% select(personid),bothscores) %>%
  mutate_all(fill_na)
cohortscores %>%
  head(10)
cohortscores %>%
  filter(`sum(score_AHRQ)`+`sum(score_van_Walraven)`+`sum(score_charlson)`>0) %>%
  head(10)
plot(cohortscores)
cor(cohortscores)
